edu.ucla.sspace.similarity

Interface SimilarityFunction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSymmetricSimilarityFunction, AverageCommonFeatureRank, CosineSimilarity, DotProduct, EuclideanSimilarity, GaussianKernel, JaccardIndex, KendallsTau, KLDivergence, LinSimilarity, OneSimilarity, PearsonCorrelation, PolynomialKernel, SpearmanRankCorrelation, TanimotoCoefficient

    public interface SimilarityFunction
    An Interface for any similarity metric between two Vectors. Methods should provide efficient support for sparse vectors if an implementation is feasible as these metrics are heavily used in some algorithms. Metrics should note via isSymmetric() whether or not they are symmetic, whereby method.sim(A,B) == method.sim(B,A) always holds true for any A,B. If the metric takes in any parameters, such as weights, they can use the setParams(double...) method, which can take in any number of double arguments. Methods should also provide a no argument constructor that has reasonable default values, or loads values from system properties.
    Author:
    Keith Stevens

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isSymmetric()
      Returns true if sim(A,B) == sim(B,A) is true for any A, B.

      Sets an double parameters, such as weights, for this SimilarityFunction.
      double sim(DoubleVector v1, DoubleVector v2)
      Returns the similarity between v1 and v2.
      double sim(IntegerVector v1, IntegerVector v2)
      Returns the similarity between v1 and v2.
      double sim(Vector v1, Vector v2)
      Returns the similarity between v1 and v2.

    • Method Detail

      • setParams

        void setParams(double... arguments)
        Sets an double parameters, such as weights, for this SimilarityFunction.

      • isSymmetric

        boolean isSymmetric()
        Returns true if sim(A,B) == sim(B,A) is true for any A, B.

      • sim

        double sim(DoubleVector v1,
         DoubleVector v2)
        Returns the similarity between v1 and v2. If isSymmetric() is false, the ordering does matter.

      • sim

        double sim(IntegerVector v1,
         IntegerVector v2)
        Returns the similarity between v1 and v2. If isSymmetric() is false, the ordering does matter.

      • sim

         Vector v2)
        Returns the similarity between v1 and v2. If isSymmetric() is false, the ordering does matter.
